required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PTP1B Implication in the Vascular Dysfunction Associated With Obstructive Sleep Apnea
clinical_study.official_title: PTP1B Implication in the Vascular Dysfunction Associated With Obstructive Sleep Apnea

brief_summary.textblock:
Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) syndrome is associated with increased vascular dysfunction and atherosclerosis. Especially, it has been shown that OSA associated intermittent hypoxia represents a pro inflammatory stimulus resulting in macrophage polarization.
Protein tyrosine phosphatase 1B (PTP1B) is a negative regulator of insulin signaling pathways involved in atherosclerosis. It has been shown that myeloid PTP1B deficiency protects against atherosclerosis.
As hypoxia has also been shown to increase PTP1B expression and activity, this study will evaluate the myeloid PTP1B expression and activity in patients with OSA as compared to controls and will investigate myeloid PTP1B involvement in the vascular pro inflammatory precess described in OSA.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: patients with OSA 'apnea hypopnea index ≥ 15 per hour) as compared to controls (an apnea hypopnea index < 15 per hour)

primary_outcome.description: Peripheral blood will be collected from OSA and non OSA patients. Macrophage will be isolated by specific centrifugation. PTP1B expression will be assessed by Western Blot.
Peripheral blood will be collected from OSA and non OSA patients. Macrophage will be isolated by specific centrifugation. PTP1B activity will be assessed by specific colorimetric assay.

secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral blood will be collected from OSA and non OSA patients. Exosomes will be isolated by consecutive centrifugations. PTP1B expression will be assessed by Western Blot.

secondary_outcome.measure: in vitro PTP1B implication on macrophage inflammatory response
secondary_outcome.description: Macrophage isolated from patients will be stimulated by pro inflammatory agents (IL6, TNF alpha) in the presence and absence of PTP1B inhibitor (MSI-1436). The inflammatory response will be assessed by measuring inflammatory cytokines in the supernatant by ELISA.

arm_group.description: 30 patients investigated for suspected OSA with an apnea hypopnea index ≥ 15 per hour
30 patients investigated for suspected OSA with an apnea hypopnea index < 15 per hour

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Overnight polysomnographic recording for suspected OSA
- Apnea hypopnea index ≥ 15 per hour for OSA patients
- Apnea hypopnea index < 15 per hour for non OSA patients
Exclusion Criteria:
- past history of cardiovascular diseases
- diabetes
- dyslipidemia
- hypertension
- obesity (body mass index > 35 kg/m2
- past history or ongoing inflammatory diseases
- cognition impairment
